node.html:
Currently in the process of designing an early-stage MVP concept focused on lightweight, low-friction student connections within a campus setting.

Exploring how minimal, intentional design choices can encourage organic participation without relying on traditional social networking features.

frontmatter.title: Quality Improvement Project: Data-Driven Weight Management

node.html:
Applied healthcare Quality Improvement (QI) methods to a personal weight management project using outcome, process, and balancing measures.

Used run charts and structured PDSA cycles to analyze trends and drive sustained improvement.

frontmatter.title: Cohort Study Analysis: Smoking Cessation & Life Expectancy

node.html:
Analyzed a landmark cohort study examining the impact of smoking cessation on life expectancy.

Focused on interpreting exposure–outcome relationships, risk differences, and translating long-term population data into clear public health insights.

frontmatter.title: Lifestyle Intervention Study for Hypertension Control

node.html:
Designed a randomized controlled trial evaluating whether a combined plant-based diet and diaphragmatic breathing intervention improves diastolic blood pressure in adults aged 60+.

Developed hypotheses, eligibility criteria, outcome measures, and a seed-grant proposal aligned with healthcare systems.

frontmatter.title: Information Retrieval Evaluation with Hybrid Human–Synthetic Labels

node.html:
Improved ranking evaluation reliability by combining synthetic relevance labels with targeted human-corrected judgments, increasing nDCG@10 by 28%.

Demonstrated that limited human feedback can significantly improve evaluation quality while keeping labeling effort low.

Performed an end-to-end SAS analysis on a real student performance dataset, including data cleaning, feature engineering, regression modeling, clustering, and visualization.

Generated a complete analytical report using ODS with actionable insights on academic performance drivers.

Conducted an in-silico study analyzing pathogenic PAH gene mutations associated with Phenylketonuria (PKU).

Evaluated mutation-driven structural changes and ligand binding differences using molecular docking and interaction profiling techniques.
